question:
Consider the following statements about the newly signed “Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons”:
  1. It is the first multilateral legally-binding treaty for nuclear disarmament
  2. India is a signatory to the treaty
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Recently, on 20 September, 2017, the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons was signed at the United Nations headquarters. This is the first multilateral legally-binding instrument for nuclear disarmament to have been negotiated in 20 years was adopted. While 122 countries voted in favour of the treaty, Netherlands voted against it, Singapore abstained, and 69 nations did not vote. India and other nuclear-armed nations- the United States, Russia, Britain, China, France, Pakistan, North Korea and Israel had not participated in the negotiations.
